definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.chinese: 湯姆把他的筆借給了我。

sentences.english: I will lend you all the few books that I can spare.
sentences.chinese: 我願把我能不用的書都借給你，儘管這些書爲數不多。

sentences.english: Without further ado, he took out his pen and lent it to me.
sentences.chinese: 他二話沒說，拿出筆來，把它借給了我。

sentences.english: She raked out a detective story and lent it to her friend.
sentences.chinese: 她翻出一本偵探小說借給了她的朋友。

sentences.english: No, but he lent it to her.
sentences.chinese: 沒給，不外他把書借給她了。

sentences.english: But now I can give her ten or even a whole sackful.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在我能借給她十個，甚至整整一袋了。

sentences.english: Thanks for lending me 200 USD, you are A-OK in my book.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你借給我200美元，你總是這麼好。

sentences.english: The plaintiff loaned the defendant money, and the defendant failed to repay it.
sentences.chinese: 原告借給被告錢，被告到期不能償還。

sentences.english: Ron lent me the money on condition that I pay it back next month.
sentences.chinese: 歲恩把錢借給我，條件是下月歸還。

sentences.english: For the vision of one man lends not its wings to another man.
sentences.chinese: 因爲一個人的洞察力不能將其羽翼借給另一個人。

sentences.english: Lend me a double-ended spanner please.
After all, he did you a faver by lending it to you in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟他一開始還是幫了你一個忙，把錢借給你了。

sentences.english: Somebody else lent me a pump and helped me mend the puncture.
sentences.chinese: 別人借給我一個打氣筒，又幫我補好了輪胎。

sentences.english: You’ll never save money if you keep lending it out to friends.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不斷的把錢借給朋友，你就不會攢錢。

sentences.english: B： Was it enough to lend me some?
